metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Form Elements
This chapter describes all the different HTML form elements.
content.html: This chapter describes all the different HTML form elements.

content.text: The HTML <form> Elements
The HTML <form> element can contain one or more of the following form elements:
content.html: The HTML <form> element can contain one or more of the following form elements:

content.text: The <input> Element
One of the most used form elements is the <input> element.
content.html: One of the most used form elements is the <input> element.

content.text: The <input> element can be displayed in several ways, depending on the type attribute.
content.html: The <input> element can be displayed in several ways, depending on the type attribute.

content.code_html:
<label for="fname">First name:</label>
<input type="text" id="fname" name="fname">

content.text: All the different values of the type attribute are covered in the next chapter: HTML Input Types .
content.html: All the different values of the type attribute are covered in the next chapter: HTML Input Types.

content.text: The <label> Element
The <label> element defines a label for several form elements.
content.html: The <label> element defines a label for several form elements.

content.text: The <label> element is useful for screen-reader users, because the screen-reader will read out loud the label when the user focus on the input element.
content.html: The <label> element is useful for screen-reader users, because the screen-reader will read out loud the label when the user focus on the input element.

content.text: The <label> element also help users who have difficulty clicking on very small regions (such as radio buttons or checkboxes) - because when the user clicks the text within the <label> element, it toggles the radio button/checkbox.
content.html: The <label> element also help users who have difficulty clicking on very small regions (such as radio buttons or checkboxes) - because when the user clicks the text within the <label> element, it toggles the radio button/checkbox.

content.text: The for attribute of the <label> tag should be equal to the id attribute of the <input> element to bind them together.
content.html: The for attribute of the <label> tag should be equal to the id attribute of the <input> element to bind them together.

content.text: The <select> Element
The <select> element defines a drop-down list:
content.html: The <select> element defines a drop-down list:

content.code:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars">
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>


<option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>


<option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>
content.code_html:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars">
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
  <option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>
  <option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>

content.text: The <option> element defines an option that can be selected.
content.html: The <option> element defines an option that can be selected.

content.text: By default, the first item in the drop-down list is selected.
content.html: By default, the first item in the drop-down list is selected.

content.text: To define a pre-selected option, add the selected attribute to the option:
content.html: To define a pre-selected option, add the selected attribute to the option:

content.code_html: <option value="fiat" selected>Fiat</option>

content.text: Visible Values:
Use the size attribute to specify the number of visible values:
content.html: Use the size attribute to specify the number of visible values:

content.code:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars" size="3">
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>


<option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>


<option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>
content.code_html:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars" size="3">
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
  <option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>
  <option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>

content.text: Allow Multiple Selections:
Use the multiple attribute to allow the user to select more than one value:
content.html: Use the multiple attribute to allow the user to select more than one value:

content.code:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars" size="4" multiple>
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>


<option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>


<option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>
content.code_html:
<label for="cars">Choose a car:</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars" size="4" multiple>
  <option value="volvo">Volvo</option>
  <option value="saab">Saab</option>
  <option value="fiat">Fiat</option>
  <option value="audi">Audi</option>
</select>

content.text: The <textarea> Element
The <textarea> element defines a multi-line input field (a text area):
content.html: The <textarea> element defines a multi-line input field (a text area):

content.code:
<textarea name="message" rows="10" cols="30">
The cat was playing in the garden.
</textarea>
content.code_html:
<textarea name="message" rows="10" cols="30">
The cat was playing in the garden.
</textarea>

content.text: The rows attribute specifies the visible number of lines in a text area.
content.html: The rows attribute specifies the visible number of lines in a text area.

content.text: The cols attribute specifies the visible width of a text area.
content.html: The cols attribute specifies the visible width of a text area.

content.text: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:
content.html: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:

content.text: You can also define the size of the text area by using CSS:
content.html: You can also define the size of the text area by using CSS:

content.code:
<textarea name="message" 
style="width:200px; height:600px;">
The cat was playing in the garden.
</textarea>
content.code_html:
<textarea name="message" style="width:200px; height:600px;">
The cat was playing in the garden.
</textarea>

content.text: The <button> Element
The <button> element defines a clickable button:
content.html: The <button> element defines a clickable button:

content.code_html: <button type="button" onclick="alert('Hello World!')">Click Me!</button>

content.text: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:
content.html: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:

content.text: Note: Always specify the type attribute for the button element. Different browsers may use different default types for the button element.
content.html: Note: Always specify the type attribute for the button element. Different browsers may use different default types for the button element.

content.text: The <fieldset> and <legend> Elements
The <fieldset> element is used to group related data in a form.
content.html: The <fieldset> element is used to group related data in a form.

content.text: The <legend> element defines a caption for the <fieldset> element.
content.html: The <legend> element defines a caption for the <fieldset> element.

content.code: Personalia:
content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <fieldset>
    <legend>Personalia:</legend>
    <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
    <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" value="John"><br>
    <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
    <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" value="Doe"><br><br>
    <input type="submit" value="Submit">
  </fieldset>
</form>

content.text: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:
content.html: This is how the HTML code above will be displayed in a browser:

content.text: The <datalist> Element
The <datalist> element specifies a list of pre-defined options for an <input> element.
content.html: The <datalist> element specifies a list of pre-defined options for an <input> element.

content.text: Users will see a drop-down list of the pre-defined options as they input data.
content.html: Users will see a drop-down list of the pre-defined options as they input data.

content.text: The list attribute of the <input> element, must refer to the id attribute of the <datalist> element.
content.html: The list attribute of the <input> element, must refer to the id attribute of the <datalist> element.

content.code:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <input list="browsers">


<datalist id="browsers">

<option value="Edge">


<option value="Firefox">

<option value="Chrome">


<option value="Opera">

<option value="Safari">


</datalist> 
</form>
content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php">
  <input list="browsers">
  <datalist id="browsers">
    <option value="Edge">
    <option value="Firefox">
    <option value="Chrome">
    <option value="Opera">
    <option value="Safari">
  </datalist>
</form>

content.text: The <output> Element
The <output> element represents the result of a calculation (like one performed by a script).
content.html: The <output> element represents the result of a calculation (like one performed by a script).

content.code: 0   100 +   =
content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php"
  oninput="x.value=parseInt(a.value)+parseInt(b.value)">
  0
  <input type="range"  id="a" name="a" value="50">
  100 +
  <input type="number" id="b" name="b" value="50">
  =
  <output name="x" for="a b"></output>
  <br><br>
  <input type="submit">
</form>

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct HTML element to group related data in a form and also, by default, draw a border around it?
content.html: What is the correct HTML element to group related data in a form and also, by default, draw a border around it?

metadata.question: What is the correct HTML element to group related data in a form and also, by default, draw a border around it?

content.question: What is the correct HTML element to group related data in a form and also, by default, draw a border around it?

content.text: HTML Form Elements

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<form> Defines an HTML form for user input
<input> Defines an input control
<textarea> Defines a multiline input control (text area)
<label> Defines a label for an <input> element
<fieldset> Groups related elements in a form
<legend> Defines a caption for a <fieldset> element
<select> Defines a drop-down list
<optgroup> Defines a group of related options in a drop-down list
<option> Defines an option in a drop-down list
<button> Defines a clickable button
<datalist> Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls
<output> Defines the result of a calculation

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
